newsitem.title: SPAIN: Blast near Seville, Spain railway station hurts one.
newsitem.headline: Blast near Seville, Spain railway station hurts one.

text.p: The blast from a small bomb planted near a railway station in the southern Spanish city of Seville injured one person on Tuesday, region officials said.
Officials did not say whether it was an attack by ETA Basque separatist rebels, but the group has often used bombs in the 29-year independence drive in which it has killed some 800 people.
The officials said the injured person was a construction worker who was taken to hospital and was only slightly hurt.
The bomb, which exploded at 2.15 p.m. (1215 GMT), had been planted in construction materials near the Santa Justa station, officials said.
ETA (Basque Homeland and Freedom) has killed seven people since the start of the year.
